qas.question: What nation influenced the Crusaders mosaic styles?
Where is the Church of the Holy Sepulchre located?
What is the name of the lone surviving mosaic of the Crusader period?
Where is the mosaic "Ascension of Christ" located?
The Byzantine emperor, the king of Jerusalem and the Latin Church came together in what year to redecorate the Church of the Holy Sepulchre?

context: The Crusaders in the Holy Land also adopted mosaic decoration under local <a0_0>Byzantine<a0_0/> influence. During their 12th-century reconstruction of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre in <a1_0>Jerusalem<a1_0/> they complemented the existing Byzantine mosaics with new ones. Almost nothing of them survived except the <a2_0>"Ascension of Christ"<a2_0/> <a3_0>in the Latin Chapel<a3_0/> (now confusingly surrounded by many 20th-century mosaics). More substantial fragments were preserved from the 12th-century mosaic decoration of the Church of the Nativity in Bethlehem. The mosaics in the nave are arranged in five horizontal bands with the figures of the ancestors of Christ, Councils of the Church and angels. In the apses the Annunciation, the Nativity, Adoration of the Magi and Dormition of the Blessed Virgin can be seen. The program of redecoration of the church was completed in <a4_0>1169<a4_0/> as a unique collaboration of the Byzantine emperor, the king of Jerusalem and the Latin Church.
